channel.title: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?
channel.description:
Lots of contributions?
Long time registered?
High reputation?
Seems they don't give them out anymore.

item.title: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

The Soul:

Someone needs to nominate you and then others decide. The member must have a ratio of 2:1 in votes to be made veteran.

2 (+1) : 1 ?

Read full topic
item.source: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?

item.title: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:32, topic:340202”][quote author=faded vision link=topic=436571.msg3208709#msg3208709 date=1274036477]
Give us Image signatures
Avatars
More themes
Smf forum portal?
Way more boards, we have like 10 and rserver have like 40.

[/quote]
No. We want this forum to look professional and not like a 12 year old runs it.[/quote]

it would be nice to have a feature like youtube does.

like you can set yourself to director, musician, comedian etc.

it would be cool to have things like: Modeler, Programmer, Helping Hand etc…

and you could set it on your profile and it would display a badge or something under your name. thats my opinion though

Read full topic
item.source: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?

item.title: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:19, topic:340202”][quote author=faded vision link=topic=436571.msg3207654#msg3207654 date=1273950206]
Theres a bunch of stuff I wanna suggest for the moparscape forums to improve them, I own a 54,000 member forum myself so I am used to managing them.

Although there is no suggestions board.
[/quote]

And there never will be. Mopar is too lazy to improve this forum, i talked to him about it, he said suggest stuff to him, but never listened.

If he wanted to improve this board he’d add a 400 revision board.

[quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=436571.msg3207727#msg3207727 date=1273956155]

There are community members too. I havent seen one active community member but anyway its not up to us to decide
[/quote]Evil_ and jme are both active community members here.

And neither are EVER on moparscape.[/quote]

youre funny.

400 revision board/servers is/are pointless because theres no map data for 474 and hardly anyone codes 459s
and ive only seen like 1 422 server project and it didnt last long.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?

item.title: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:28, topic:340202”][quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=436571.msg3208203#msg3208203 date=1273990595]

No you have to have a J in your name. Duh

Damn, means I’m out of the running.

@THREAD - Trust me, this is nothing easily obtainable, you must work for it. Actually work, not just find easy stuff people have already setup.
[/quote]
I don’t know… it’s not like it’s anything hard to get, rifk. Basic programming knowledge on mscp pretty much will put you in the running for it.[/quote]
Basic knowledge is far away for many.

Read full topic

item.source: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?

item.title: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?
item.dc:creator: @gothic_queen casey.
item.description:
@gothic_queen wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:22, topic:340202”]If you want the position then you’ll have to earn it through valuable contributions to the community. Time, reputation, and a high number of worthless contributions amount to nothing. Someone could sign up today, make some incredible contribution, and be voted in tomorrow.

If you want in then you become a proficient programmer and then contribute good, usable code or good insight. In my opinion, nobody can offer good insight unless they’re a proficient programmer anyway, so there’s no escaping the fact that you won’t cut it if you can’t program.[/quote]

or become incredible suck up like Yz85racer

Read full topic
item.source: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?

item.title: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

If you want the position then you’ll have to earn it through valuable contributions to the community. Time, reputation, and a high number of worthless contributions amount to nothing. Someone could sign up today, make some incredible contribution, and be voted in tomorrow.

If you want in then you become a proficient programmer and then contribute good, usable code or good insight. In my opinion, nobody can offer good insight unless they’re a proficient programmer anyway, so there’s no escaping the fact that you won’t cut it if you can’t program.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?

item.title: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

Veterans are people that mean something to this site and are respected members that have been nominated for the position. Very simple

Read full topic
item.source: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?

item.title: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:19, topic:340202”][quote author=faded vision link=topic=436571.msg3207654#msg3207654 date=1273950206]
Theres a bunch of stuff I wanna suggest for the moparscape forums to improve them, I own a 54,000 member forum myself so I am used to managing them.

Although there is no suggestions board.
[/quote]

And there never will be. Mopar is too lazy to improve this forum, i talked to him about it, he said suggest stuff to him, but never listened.

If he wanted to improve this board he’d add a 400 revision board.

[quote author=The Reaper X link=topic=436571.msg3207727#msg3207727 date=1273956155]

There are community members too. I havent seen one active community member but anyway its not up to us to decide
[/quote]Evil_ and jme are both active community members here.

And neither are EVER on moparscape.[/quote]

You’re quite wrong when you say that he doesn’t improve/update the site, there is a lot of back-room maintanence that goes on, and i’m certain that he does take in suggestions. When you say a 400 revision board is needed, you’ve to prove to us why there is one needed. Unless there is a decent server provided to base it off, why should it be added?

Also both of them check and maintain moparscape a lot, referring to Jme and Evil_.

Read full topic
item.source: How do you become a Moparscape Veteran?
